title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: "G'ye way oot o' that !" he said instantly, with the threatening gesture which every villager except the minister and the mistress of Arkland instinctively  made on seeing a M'Lurg.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Immediately  after Jock and Rab had received a hunch of the Arkland loaf and their covenanted drink of milk, they went off to drive the cows to the loch road, so that they might at once begin to fill up their lean sides.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: sic a graun' big loaf come frae the Arkland ! " B}' this time all her audience were on their feet.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: They caught the Arkland donkey grazing in the field beside the mill dam, and having made a parcel of the good black trousers and jacket, they tied them to the donkey and drove him homeward with blows and shoutings.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: At one time he looked as though he would even better repay attention, for he feigned a sleek-faced submission and a ready compliance which put Mistress Auld of the Arkland off her guard.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: The minister's text on the following Sabbath morning was an old one, but it was no old sermon that the Arkland folk got that day.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: A plain man was John Smith of Arkland — as plain and hodden grey as his name.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Things had not gone well in Arkland that week.

title: The Stickit minister :
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: It is Friday, and the minister of Arkland was writing his sermon.
